commercial.translation[0].definitions[0]: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services
Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
commercial.translation[0].definitions[1]: related to the ability of a product or business to make a profit
Gibbons failed to see the commercial value of his discovery.
The film was a huge commercial success.
commercial.translation[0].definitions[2]: a commercial product is one that is produced and sold in large quantities
commercial.translation[0].definitions[3]: more concerned with money than with quality
Their music has become very commercial.
commercial.translation[0].note_box[0].se: Several large commercial banks cut their lending rates.
Many commercial companies are having financial difficulties.
He decided to invest in commercial property.
The president’s reform programme threatened US commercial interests.
A product like this should do well in the commercial market.
The increased number of tourists has resulted in further commercial development.
The trees were planted for commercial use.
the commercial exploitation of mineral resources
Commercial activity in our society is highly competitive.
Commercial considerations must come second to conservation of the environment.
The deal was a straightforward commercial transaction.
commercial.translation[1].definitions[0]: an advertisement on television or radio
commercial.translation[2].definitions[0]: relating to business and the buying and selling of goods and services
Oran is a large commercial city on the coast.
protests against commercial development on green field sites
commercial.translation[2].definitions[1]: relating to the ability of a product or business to make a profit
We do not want to see ivory having a commercial value.
The invention enjoyed great commercial success.
commercial.translation[2].definitions[2]: a commercial product is one that is produced in large quantities and sold to the public
commercial.translation[2].definitions[3]: a port etc that provides a service for the general public to use and is run to make a profit
This aircraft was the first Boeing 727 to carry fare-paying passengers on a commercial flight.
commercial.translation[2].definitions[4]: radio and television broadcasts that are produced by companies that earn money through advertising, rather than ones owned by the state
It has become the most popular commercial radio station in Britain.
commercial.translation[2].definitions[5]: more concerned with money than with quality
The record company tried to make me write songs that were very commercial.
commercial.translation[3].definitions[0]: an advertisement on television or radio, or at the cinema
She’s appeared in a coffee commercial.
a commercial for a brand of aftershave
The campaigns were designed to run as television or cinema commercials.
commercial.translation[3].definitions[1]: shares in companies that produce and sell consumer goods, rather than companies involved in industrial processes
